ISSUE.TITLE: Dashboard broken after adding widget
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Deployment Type Self-hosted ### NetBox Version v4.2.3 ### Python Version 3.12 ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Go to main dashboard page and click Unlock. 2. Click Add Widget. 3. Select object type Notifications. 4. Click Save. Dashboard gets the error from the screenshot below. ### Expected Behavior We shouldn't be able to select models that don't work, or cause the dashboard to break. ### Observed Behavior ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7afbf649-4691-4e96-9357-27e3a09693b5)

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Add docstrings for get_queryset base class methods (#18832)

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Fixes #18782: properly check if htmx_url is None If this is done incorrently, then the string formatting operation turns `htmx_url` into a string and the test in the template fails.
Merge pull request #18854 from netbox-community/18782-dashboard-broken-on-notification-list-widget Fixes #18782: Misconfigured `ObjectListWidget`s now degrade gracefully
